heading: 2 Pathway basics
text: pathway model graph diagram representing biological process set interactions relationships among genes, proteins, metabolites, factors context cellular compartments, tissues organisms.

heading: 2.1 Ten simple rules
text: Ten simple rules creating reusable pathway models computational analysis visualization (Hanspers et al., 2021) paper provides guidelines creating pathway models.pathway model defined set interactions among biological entities (e.g., proteins metabolites) relevant particular context, curated organized illustrate particular process.

heading: 4.1 Graphical Pathway Markup Language (GPML)
text:
Graphical Pathway Markup Language (GPML) native file format used store edit pathway models PathVisio share WikiPathways.current GPML version used GPML2021.Please note PathVisio 4.0.0 (uses libGPML) works GPML version 2021 2013a. pathway model written GPML2013a opened PathVisio 4.x automatically converted GPML2021 saved.
Figure 0.1: Warning message opening older GPML2013a file
save pathway model GPML2013a format, please export GPML2013a format: File > Export

heading: 4.2 PathVisio File Formats
text: Default file format GPML2021GPML file (.gpml, .xml)Pathway models can exported following formatsGPML2013a file (.gpml, .xml)PDF (.pdf)PNG (.png)SVG (.svg)DataNode list (.txt)Eu. Gene pathway (.pwf)

heading: 7 Pathway elements
text:
describe commonly used terminology concepts used PathVisio, libGPML, GPML, WikiPathways.main components pathway model referred Pathway Elements.
Figure 0.1: PathVisio4 user interface, open pathway WP4876. diagram, color DataNodes (Purple), States (Orange), Interactions/Graphical Lines (Light Blue), Lables (Red), Shapes (Green), Groups (Dark Blue).
DataNodes - denotes biological entity forms node pathway.
Aliases - special data node type.
Aliases - special data node type.States - represents specific state biological entity (e.g.¬†phosphorylation, genetic variants, etc). state linked data node.Interactions - represents biological relation entities.Graphical Lines - visual annotation without semantic meaning. often used partition space connect pathway elements.Labels - text field can used annotate aspect pathwayShapes - visual annotation graphical element.Groups - collection structurally functionally similar related pathway elements.

heading: 8 Data Nodes
text:
Data Node denotes biological entity forms node pathway. two categories Data Node Types: Molecular DataNodes Concept DataNodes.
Figure 0.1: Object Panel options Data Nodes

heading: 8.1.1 GeneProduct
text: entity representing product given gene, including DNA, RNA Protein. generic representation gene-based biomolecule useful one representation might useful given context

heading: 8.1.2 Metabolite
text: entity representing metabolite, including chemical compounds participate produced metabolic reactions, also chemical compounds participate pathway otherwise.

heading: 8.1.3 Protein
text: biomolecular polymer amino acids, translated mRNA.

heading: 8.1.4 DNA
text: entity representing DNA polymer.

heading: 8.1.5 RNA
text: entity representing RNA peptide, including mRNA, miRNA, etc. commonly used explicitly represent mRNA transcripts (excluding DNA protein forms) RNA species, like miRNA, exRNA, lncRNA, etc

heading: 8.1.6 Complex (deprecated)
text: Complex Data Node Type deprecated. use similar Alias.

heading: 8.2.1 Pathway
text: biological process representing set interactions relationships among genes, proteins, metabolites, factors context cellular compartments, tissues organisms.

heading: 8.2.4 Alias
text: Alias special type Data Node can represent Group pathway element (entity). Please see Aliases information!

heading: 8.2.8 Undefined
text: unspecified biological entity factor. used type truly unknown different ones covered data node types.

heading: 9 Aliases
text: Alias special type Data Node can represent Group pathway element (entity). Alias Data Node can linked existing Group.

text: Alias Data Nodes can added existing Group (linked selected group) using Objects Panel (link group later).

heading: 9.2 Adding and Deleting an Alias from a Group

text: Right-click Group select ‚ÄúAdd Alias‚Ä¶‚Äù. new Alias Data Node linked Group.

heading: 9.2.2 To Remove an Alias:
text: remove Alias, click Alias delete normal.

heading: 9.3 Linking and Unlinking an Alias to a Group
text: Use Objects Panel add DataNode type Alias.

heading: 9.3.1 To Link an Alias Data Node to a Group:
text: Right-click select ‚ÄúLink Group‚Ä¶‚ÄùClick select Group wish link Alias DataNode

heading: 9.3.2 To Unlink an Alias Data Node from the referenced Group:
text: Right-click select ‚ÄúUnlink Group‚Ä¶‚Äù

heading: 16 Why add information?
text: mentioned , Ten simple rules creating reusable pathway models computational analysis visualization (Hanspers et al., 2021) paper provides guidelines creating pathway models. Rules 5 6 particular highlight importance adding information pathway models.Rule 5: Provide literature references, provenance, evidence pathway contentRule 6: Annotate pathway models title, description, ontology termsIn general machine readable information pathway pathway elements can‚Ä¶Improve findability organization pathway models.Improve readability reusability pathway.used automatically filter pathway content presence type supporting evidence.Support linking pathway model content databases retrieval additional information

text: pathway, can add:Comments - descriptions arbitrary notes objectAnnotationsCitationsEvidencesProperties/Pathway meta-information - e.g.¬†title, authors, etc.

heading: 16.2 Pathway element information
text: Pathway Elements can add:Comments - descriptions arbitrary notes objectAnnotationsCitationsEvidencesProperties

heading: 17.1 Required pathway information
text: Title - concise descriptive name pathway modelOrganism - main organism

heading: 17.2 Optional pathway information
text: Description - description pathway (e.g.¬†major steps)Source - WikiPathwaysVersionLicenseAuthorCommentDatabase:IdentifierItalicized fields generally edited PathVisio

heading: 18 Properties
text: section discuss Properties add information Pathway Pathway Elements, rather Graphical/Style properties Line color, line width, etc.Pathway Pathway Elements, can edit Properties. Properties can accessed edited one two ways:Double clicking Pathway (InfoBox top left corner) Pathway Element, dialog open Properties tab.selecting Pathway (InfoBox top left corner) Pathway Element navigating Properties Panel (right side).

heading: 20 Annotations
text: Annotation reference additional information, can add Pathway Element provide additional information.Required information Annotation :Value - termType - Annotation typeOptional information Annotation :Identifier - identifier database Annotation.Database - database Annotation.Url link - url link Annotation.

heading: 20.1 Annotation Types
text: Ontology (e.g.subcellular location)Taxonomy (e.g.organism)Undefined ()

heading: 20.2 Databases/DataSources
text: number possible DataSources Annotations. learn , please see BridgeDb.

heading: 20.3.1 From Properties Dialog
text: can navigate window add Annotation :Double clicking Pathway Element.Selecting Annotations Tab.Clicking ‚ÄúNew annotation‚Äù button.Enter required Annotation information.

heading: 20.3.2 From Right-Click > Add Reference > Add Annotation
text: can navigate window add Annotation :Right-click Pathway Element > Add Reference > Add Annotation. enter required Annotation information.can navigate Annotations Tab Window two ways:Double clicking Pathway Element selecting Annotations tab.Right-click Pathway Element > Edit Reference > Edit Annotations.Edit Annotation, mouse Annotation click Blue Edit button. Enter information normal.

heading: 20.4 Deleting an Annotation
text: Delete Annotation, mouse Annotation click Red Delete button.

heading: 20.5 Nested Citations and Evidences (Advanced)
text: Annotation can contain nested Citations /Evidences related support current Annotation. now, PathVisio4 user interface support nested References. Advanced users may added nested Citations Evidences manually editing GPML2021 file text editor.add nested Citations /Evidences Annotation Pathway Element, must following:Add nested CitationRef elementRef pointing elementId Citation. Add nested EvidenceRef elementRef pointing elementId EvidenceThe Citation /Evidence information end GPML, may also need added manually Citation /org Evidence already referenced elsewhere pathway.
code:
<AnnotationRef elementRef="a0001">
  <CitationRef elementRef="c0002" />
  <EvidenceRef elementRef="e0003" />
</AnnotationRef><Annotations>
  <Annotation elementId="a0001" name="thyroid cancer" type="Disease">
      <Xref identifier="1781" dataSource="DOID"/>
        <Url link="https://identifiers.org/DOID:1781"/>
  </Annotation>
</Annotations>
<Citations>
    <Citation elementId="c0002">
        <Xref identifier="7730304" dataSource="pubmed"/>
        <Url link="https://identifiers.org/pubmed:7730304"/>
    </Citation>
</Citations>
<Evidences>
    <Evidence elementId="e0003" value="experimental evidence">
        <Xref identifier="0000006" dataSource="ECO"/>
        <Url link="https://identifiers.org/ECO:0000006"/>
    </Evidence>
</Evidences>

Enter information normal.

        <AnnotationRef elementRef="a0002" />

heading: 24 Themes
text: theme predefined combination colors shapes (data nodes). Themes can applied pathway models, allowing quick easy way change look pathway model.

heading: 24.0.1 Some things to consider
text: Applying theme may cause undesired changes.Users may choose ‚ÄúPreview‚Äù theme applying .Immediately theme applied, can still removed ‚ÄúUndo‚Äù.user may need manually edit pathway model achieve desired look.Users free choose colors, please aware recommended default colors shapes data nodes.

heading: 24.1 WikiPathways Theme
text:
WikiPathways Theme recommended theme pathway model components (especially data nodes) created colors defined WikiPathways Website Style. colors always also WikiPathways Palette, see Color Palettes.WikiPathways Theme applied pathway model, data node graphics color shape type set default values!Molecular data nodes rectangles
Concept data nodes rounded rectangles (except Alias data nodes)
Figure 0.1: default color(text, border, fill) shape data nodes according WikiPathways Theme

heading: 24.2 Applying a Theme
text:
can apply theme menu bar Theme button Tools > Apply Theme.figure , see pathway Hijack ubiquitination SARS-CoV-2 (Homo sapiens) WikiPathways Theme applied - left, right.
Figure 23.1: Pathway (left) (right) WikiPathways Theme applied
resulting Blue (metabolite), Green (Pathway), Gray (Group) slightly different particular shades defined WikiPathways Style. original blue, green, gray colors typical Pathvisio 3.x. PathVisio 4.x new default colors match WikiPathways.case Orf10 protein, creator pathway originally chosen round pink shape indicate protein SARS-CoV-2 rather Homo Sapiens. However, WikiPathway Theme defines data nodes type protein black rectangles. recover appearance Orf10, creator may choose manually edit pathway model.Another change shape Pevonedistat rounded rectangle rectangle, data node type Metabolite.
